availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert Daniel Howe (Fleming County, Kentucky, laborer)

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky, laborer. Fleming County, Kentucky native. Son of Andrew W. Howe and Margaret G. Fichlir Howe. Resident of Fleming County in 1850. Laborer in Fleming County in 1860. Family owned three enslaved persons in 1850 and 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District No. 1, p. 273. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District No. 1, p. 273. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District No. 2, p. 128. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District No. 2, p. 12. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Poplar Plains, p. 8.
